I don't know what Bloodbath Kavkaz is trying to be. It's definitely from Eastern Europe, all right. But I know that, gamewise, it's a tremendous ♥♥♥♥ing mess, and it's definitely not as good as the game it is trying to imitate. Is it trying to filter the experience of Hotline Miami through half-empty vodka bottles and angry screeds against Vladimir Putin? It certainly feels that way - the camera physically makes me want to throw up, and the design overall feels like trying to crash a party blasted out of my mind, not quite over the peak of drunkenness that seperates the great buzz from several alcoholic beverages from the regret of having several alcoholic beverages.

But here's the thing: Hotline Miami works because it is designed so ♥♥♥♥ing tightly that the experience is seamless, anarchic, and bloody, like getting into a fight in the mosh pit at a great concert from a punk band that knows their ♥♥♥♥ and capitulates on their effort and practice. reviewText:
I'm a bit disappointed to see the massive number a bad reviews. Simply because someone made a game that wasnt geared towards english speaking players, doesnt make it a bad game. Its a good game, period. It wasnt made by a team of 100+ programmers, its not a polished masterpiece. Their are going to be issues. Biggest complaints Ive read so far are russian menus [fixable], russian story text [fixable], and sluggish graphics [fixable]. Read below for instructions on how to fix these issues and please give the game another chance if you gave up on it....its worth it.

Step 1: Access settings menu
Click the menu item one up from the bottom.

Step 2: Change menu and game language
Click the text (Русский) in the right hand collumn to change the menu text (reference picture linked above). This will change the menu language from russian to english. NOTE: Two items down from menu language you will see an item that still says Русский. Click this as well to change the story language. If you dont, you wont know whats going on in the story.

Step 3: Graphics settings
I dont know why but in full screen mode the game runs at about half speed. Its almost unplayable like this so find the full screen setting and change it to false. Once it goes windowed you can click the maximize button on the winow itself so it takes up the whole screen.

language settings save once the game is closed, but the full screen setting must be changed to windowed each time you open the game.

Bottom line
-Its a weird indie style game, if your not into the sort of thing then dont buy it.
-English is not the devs primary language, so language settings need to be changed and some story dialogue translations seem a little off.
-There are bugs, all games have them. Level starting locations seem weird, I fell off and under the floor once and had to restart to get back in the level, also guns can be picked up through walls. Glitches like that are typical here but not usually game breaking.
-Its up to you, all I'm saying is the biggest complaints in 90% of the negative reviews are easily fixable. I was entertained and happy with the purchase.

reviewText: Despite being a pretty blatant rip-off, I actually enjoy this game quite a bit. While the graphics are extremely low-rent, once I turned off all the after effects (which is necassary to get the game running above 20FPS) I found myself liking them. The same way that pixel graphics are nostalgic for a slightly older audience, the MS Paint graphics reminiscent of games found on Newgrounds or Flash Player in the early 2000s really strike a chord with me. The story is fairly interesting, and I would even rank it above Hotline Miami 2 for having actual focus, rather than just portraying a series or vaguely related events. Gameplay is the obvious weak point, with a large amount of bugs and geometry problems. AI that starts shooting the second you get within 10ft. of enemies, regardless of where they are facing/if there is a wall, makes melee combat nigh-impossible. Even with this glaring flaw, I've had a lot of fun with this game, and am looking forward to the extra modes. If you like Hotline Miami and/or weird Russian stuff, wait for the price to drop a few bucks and give it a try.

reviewText:
Is it a rip-off of Hotline Miami like many reviewers say? Not quite. The mechanics and whole concept is close, but then again you could say that HLM is a rip-off of GTA 2 with only RAMPAGE missions left in the game.

What is BBK then? I'd say it is an adoptation of HLM for Russia. To understand this game you need to live in Russia. Otherwise you will miss all the homour of the game.

Is it a bad game? The buggyness is never nice, but all other stuff is more than good. Although it makes more accent on ranged weapons (like HLM2), there are less flaws related to it than in HLM2, where you couldn't see enemies that kill you.

Should you get this game? If you are familiar with Russian segment of the Internet then yes. Otherwise you might be just another disappointed gamer.
